attributes.action: All Government forms, publications in English or English/Welsh languages only.
attributes.background:
In 2014 the public sector spent 140 million on translation services; 2017 will be considerably more.
Local councils spent at least £25m; the police £21m; the courts system spent more than £10m without accounting for the cost of legal aid; and the NHS – a conservative estimate was £55m.
attributes.additional_details:
The Human Rights Act only requires translation if someone is arrested or charged with a criminal offence.

There are far too many foreign nationals settled in the UK long term that do not or refuse to integrate fully into our society by not learning to read and write in our native languages.

Translating is not only expensive it is doing harm because it reinforces the language barrier which separates communities and hinders integration.

attributes.action: Abolish Mobile Speed Cameras
attributes.background: The use of mobile speed cameras is increasing generating masses of revenue for local authorities. Current tactics used to target drivers on the roads when going about their daily business is wrong, has a negative impact on lives and contributes only a small percentage to road safety.
attributes.additional_details:
These days it’s easy to speed in modern cars & the police know it so when traveling to work one day in a safe manner they’ll be waiting for you tucked in on some layby.

Law abiding citizens caught by these mobile speed traps feel they’ve been deliberately targeted & criminalised by the organisation set out to protect is in for gain. Millions of drivers fined for speeding over the years have seen nothing in return and whilst this continues what improvements have we seen from all these fines?

attributes.action: Withdraw Universal Jobmatch in its current form.
attributes.background:
Job Seekers are constantly being illegally pressured into opening/using Universal Jobmatch - despite the fact many Job Seekers do not trust it. In addition, many Job Search Providers do not trust Universal Jobmatch either!

Simple changes to the design of Universal Jobmatch can aleviate this:
attributes.additional_details:
Universal Jobmatch (UJ) is not fit for the purpose for which it was designed: it needs a thorough re-design so that employers cannot post vacancies anonymously - 33% of all vacancies posted on Universal Jobmatch do not exist at all!

Full name and address details for all vacancies must be included, along with a link to the employers' details on the Companies House website - where a role is advertised by an Agency, these details must be those of the Client.

Simple changes that can improve UJ!

attributes.action: Close anticlock sliproad M25 junction 1b to stop drivers cutting from junction 2
attributes.background: The anticlockwise slip road at junction 1b is used as cut through when the M25 traffic is bad. This then blocks the flow of traffic in and around Dartford resulting in major conjestion and air/noise pollution in the local area.
attributes.additional_details: The local authority have stated that they cannot install or police a box junction. If a box junction was to be installed it will likely be ignored anyway. Access to the M25 could be maintained via the junction and roundabouts at junction 2

attributes.action: Create a campaign to raise awareness of the symptoms of type 1 diabetes
attributes.background: The number of young people being diagnosed with type 1 diabetes is rising at an alarming rate. The symptoms are often missed or explained away as flu. If left undiagnosed the outcome is fatal. If diagnosis is delayed the result is life changing. We need a campaign to highlight the symptoms.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.news-medical.net/news/2007/03/19/22619.aspx

https://www.diabetes.org.uk/About_us/News_Landing_Page/UK-has-worlds-5th-highest-rate-of-Type-1-diabetes-in-children/

The statistics are frightening.
We need to raise awareness of the symptoms like we have had with meningitis and more recently sepsis.

attributes.action: Provide dedicated child bereavement teams to families after the death of a child
attributes.background:
After losing 2 children within 2 1/2 years my family was offered no support either during or after our hospital stay. We left the hospital with a pamphlet, a box and a broken heart.
Families are left to scour google for hours in the hope of finding support and it's just not good enough.
attributes.additional_details:
Today 17 babies will die, and these families wont have a clue where to turn as they begin their grieving process.
It is often left down to each family to source their own support at a time when they're at their most emotionally vulnerable.
There should be dedicated teams of professionals who can support families before, during and after the loss of their child for as long as necessary and it should be mandatory that these teams are in place and active in each case as soon as the need arises.

attributes.action: Publish a breakdown of any Brexit money agreed after negotiations are complete
attributes.background: It would seem reasonable that if we are to pay any figure to the EU on Brexit that the British public should know specifically what we are paying this money for in the form of a detailed breakdown. Particularly since the legal basis for paying any money is in doubt.
attributes.additional_details:
https://youtu.be/2Xu-hI9Ci4U

http://johnredwoodsdiary.com/2017/01/29/there-is-no-legal-basis-for-making-any-extra-payments-to-the-eu/

attributes.action: Oblige employers to give paid leave for parents of kids with chronic illnesses.
attributes.background: Parents of children with chronic illnesses (e.g. juvenile idiopathic arthritis or juvenile diabetes) need time off work for frequent medical appointments, meaning parents often lose their jobs or cannot continue to work, leading to hardship.  The law should provide for permitted, paid time off.

attributes.action: Introduce a 10p disposable cup tax in the UK
attributes.background: Based on the success of the single use plastic bag tax of October 2015, a single use cup tax would help encourage more people to switch to reusable coffee cups, further reducing the UK's plastic waste output.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove, Twitter, 6:37pm 20/11/17:
"Still haunted by last night's #BluePlanet2 - the imperative to do more to tackle plastic in our oceans is clear. We @DefraGovUK will work urgently to identify further action."

Many coffee shops like Costa and Starbucks offer customers the option to provide their own cup, usually encouraged by a small discount. This incentive, combined with the extra cost of a cup tax, should encourage many people to make a small sustainable change.

attributes.action: Mandatory bike helmets for ALL cyclists, on ALL bikes on ALL terrains
attributes.background: A friend on his bike was hit by a car. He was lucky, he could have died but he HAD a helmet on which saved his life. People are not so lucky if they’re not wearing a helmet.
attributes.additional_details:
The Consultant in Neurosciences Intensive Care, Wessex Neurological Centre, "It is my job .... to not only save lives but try to make those lives worth living. Cycle helmets offer vital protection to one’s fragile skull and can save lives and significantly reduce damage to the brain in the event of an impact. If every cyclist wore a helmet the number of cyclists killed or seriously injured each year would be reduced."

http://www.headwayoxford.org.uk/cyclehelmets/ (17 July 2017)

attributes.action: Allow women to carry pepper sprays for self defence.
attributes.background:
It's unfortunate that we we are witnessing the rise of crime especially in the last year. It is also common sense to acknowledge that women are in a higher risk to be victims of all crimes especially ones of sexual nature.
As crime is skyrocketing protecting ourselves is an obligation.
attributes.additional_details: The Office of National Statistics state that the total number of crimes reported by police arose by 10% between April 2016 and March 2017 -a total of almost 5 million crimes. Violent crimes arose by 18%, robberies by 16%, sex offences by 14% and knife crimes by 20%. Women are more likely to experience all kind of violence and 5 times as likely to experience sexual attacks.The number of rapes recorded by police has doubled in the last 4 years. The figures are worrying and women feel insecure.

attributes.action: Stop Anti-abortion Life charity from getting £250k from from UK tampon tax.
attributes.background: The government has confirmed that it is to award a quarter of a million pounds from an unpopular levy on women’s sanitary products to an anti-abortion organisation, despite objections from women’s groups and MPs.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/oct/28/anti-abortion-life-charity-will-get--tampon-tax-funds

attributes.action: Halve Tuition Fees, & bring back Maintenance Grants for all University students.
attributes.background: Universities are institutions of education, where students across the UK develop knowledge and skills. Yet, over recent years, the fees have been dramatically increased for reasons no Minister can explain. Each year, thousands of students fail to apply due to the cost. These fees must be reduced.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, if a UK student wishes to study at ANY university, for ANY course, they must pay £9,250 a YEAR, over their course length. Additionally, all students have a maintenance loan, which again, needs to be repaid. This eventually leaves many students with a debt of around £51,000 at the age of 21. This means that as soon as they enter work, that debt needs repaying. This petition would decrease student debt from around £51,000 over a lifetime to around £13,800, which is a vast improvement.

attributes.action: Ensure direct train services are maintained/improved to London from Surrey Heath
attributes.background: In recent times a direct train to London Waterloo, servicing residents from Surrey Heath (Frimley, Camberley and Bagshot) was introduced. This allowed commuters three direct trains in the morning and two returns in the evening. This is now under threat from new train franchise operator SWR.
attributes.additional_details:
SWR took over the franchise in Aug 2017. The previous operator SWT invested in extended platforms, to accommodate this service.

This is due to be removed in 2018.

Please support this pertition to prevent this vital service being removed.

attributes.action: No Clock Changes: Maintain British Summer Time through the year
attributes.background: Changing clocks twice a year is a stupid, inefficient and outdated practice.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland could have its own separate time if it needs to.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age to 21
attributes.background: I feel as everything else is going up like smoking/drinking and this shouldn't be any different also it would reduce voting fraud.

attributes.action: Allow and run a referendum in Wales to decide the future of the Welsh Assembly.
attributes.background: Over the past 20 years the many in Wales have become dissatisfied by the unnecessary bureaucracy known as the Welsh Assembly (WA).  Due to its ineffective and costly intervention at all levels of Welsh life it's time to have another referendum to allow us to decide if the WA should continue or not.
attributes.additional_details: There are many reasons why the Welsh Assembly (WA) should be dissolved.  These include excessive running costs each year.  A growing North/South Wales divide in terms of investment.  Anything that the WA does could be done by Welsh MPs in government.  The WA has gone against the wishes of Wales on leaving the EU. It appears to be nothing but a talking shop for already failed ideas and now wants to take on the role of government imposing laws and taxes that would further divide us from the UK.

attributes.action: When a defendant makes a plea in a sexual case, the jury should be made aware
attributes.background: Three girls were raped. When the case went to Crown Court, the rapist offered to plead guilty saying that he used his fingers and not his private part. The girls rejected the plea and, to the horror of all 13 witnesses, he was found not guilty. The jury should have known he offered a guilty plea.
attributes.additional_details: In future, when a defendant makes a plea in a case of sexual violence, the jury should be told

attributes.action: Use the Tampon Tax to subsidise sanitary products for girls of school age
attributes.background:
We believe the money gained through the tampon tax should be used for Period related issues.
Children of school age currently receive:
Free school meals
Free prescriptions
Free or subsided transport
Free contraception
We believe that sanitary wear should be added to this list.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39266056

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/girls-skipping-school-periods-cant-afford-tampons-sanitary-pads-a7629766.html

Periodicaldiary.com

attributes.action: Fund a veterans' bus pass for all veterans
attributes.background: The Government should demonstrate its gratitude for what all the Veterans have done for this Country so this is why I would like to start this petition.

attributes.action: Delay the sale of RBS until the taxpayer has made a profit on the bailout
attributes.background: The government bought a 72% stake in RBS after the Financial crisis and has kept it in public ownership whilst it was posting losses. This year it finally posted a healthy profit, so the Tories have decided to sell it. We will be making a £26 billion loss on this purchase.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ft.com/content/555bfe08-cf99-11e7-9dbb-291a884dd8c6

attributes.action: Eradicate the loophole that allows railway stations to be closed by stealth
attributes.background: Closure of a railway station is a serious blow to the community it serves. It deprives it of valuable transport links, and makes it much more difficult to get to and from. However, all over the country stations are being "closed by stealth" with little or any consultation of the people affected.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent example: Pilning (S Glos) - Footbridge to one platform demolished, sneaked through under the guise of a "minor modification". Now served by two trains a week in one direction only. 

We ask the Secretary of State for Transport to take the necessary steps to stop this cynical abuse of the system. Please remove the loophole that allows to close any part of a station without a proper public consultation. Make a full consultation compulsory when the change affects any passenger services.

attributes.action: Make specialist training a requirement for licensing of zoos with exotic animals
attributes.background: Currently, there are no legal requirements for a person to have gained any formal training to be awarded a licence for a zoo or sanctuary that contains exotic animals. Through the lack of expertise and knowledge this leads to the maltreatment of animals in captivity.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of specialist training leads to the maltreatment and fatality of exotic animals and risk to both public and staff. The recent death of two large cats - one which was asphyxiated during incompetent handling and the other which escaped and was euthanised when deemed to be a threat to the public - could have been avoided had appropriate training been required of the operators. Other cases of neglect of exotic animals at licensed establishments have been made public, as have deaths of handlers

attributes.action: Make it the law for children's feelings and wishes to be heard in family court
attributes.background: I want it to be the law that children can voice what they want to happen in family court, in person, by a voice recorded clip to be played or a letter to be read by the judge. Too many children are not being heard, it time to give them a voice.

attributes.action: Make the DNA testing of dogs compulsory in order to compile a national database
attributes.background: The DNA testing of dog mess is already offered by some companies and could be used to find a dog owner guilty of such an offence. The problem is there is no database for the DNA of dogs, and owners are not obliged by law to register them. A database would allow an unequivocal conviction to be made.

attributes.action: Government to provide mental health screening for all new fathers.
attributes.background: While new mothers have screening for their mental health, unfortunately fathers who also have a history if depression do not at present. With all recent research on Fathers we must provide an assessment for all parents as the biggest killer in men under fifty in the UK is SUICIDE.

attributes.action:
Impose regulations on the use of models whose body mass
index is below 18.5.
attributes.background:
This petition is to introduce a law prohibiting the use of models whose BMI is below 18.5 (the lowest healthy BMI considered by medical professionals). 
This requirement would necessitate a medical certificate from a
physician, to ensure the model is in good health.
attributes.additional_details:
This applies to models used in advertising, media, fashion shows,
catwalk shows and for any other other promotional purposes, and
applies to both male and female models.

The purpose of this requirement is to prohibit the normalisation of
low body weights and the glamorisation of an unhealthy body image.
Instead, using models with a healthy BMI of 18.5 or above would
re-calibrate the public perception of a ‘normal’ body shape and weight.

attributes.action: When we have any election include a selection for “None of the above”.
attributes.background:
This would allow me to register my vote as none of the candidates represent me in my constituency. 

This would also give the public a way to show no confidence in the current sitting representative as opposed to voting for a candidate that I do not believe in.
attributes.additional_details: The only evidence I can put forward is the large numbers that do not vote.

attributes.action: Urge Ofsted to rethink policy of asking Muslim children about wearing a Hijab
attributes.background: Amanda Spielman, the head of Ofsted, said the move was to tackle situations in which wearing a hijab “could be interpreted as sexualisation” of girls as young as four or five. Wearing Hijab is a cultural matter as much as one of 'modesty'. In many societies it's also a norm dress for Christians.
attributes.additional_details: The press has picked up on this today (18 November). This matter challenges ethnic minority rights to dress as our cultures allow for, our history, and window washing it as a 'muslim' matter. The majority of white school children are not asked by Ofsted about perming, curling, dying their hair, wearing wigs or make up. What is the difference? Allow us to parent our children appropriately until they are of age.

attributes.action: Fire Risk Assessments should be conducted by the Fire Service ONLY.
attributes.background: Following the Grenfell tower and other fires, it appears that Fire Risk Assessments can be done by anyone who has been on a 3-day training course. This is wrong. The Fire Service are more qualified than anyone. We should go back to the Fire Service issuing certificates.

attributes.action: Lower the cervical smear test age to 18!
attributes.background: We want to lower the age of smear tests from 25 to 18. If we cannot lower it to 18 we should at least let girls from 18 be allowed to get a test if they so wish!
attributes.additional_details: Every 2 in 100 girls that are diagnosed are under the age of 25. If there is history in the family of cervical cancer I believe girls should be allowed to be tested and not have to wait until they are 25! Please see sense! Sign this petition so that we may help others and potentially our children or our children's children in the future!

attributes.action: Extend the 16-19 transport bursary to pupils placed in an Independent setting.
attributes.background: This bursary is supposed to enable pupils from families on a low income to access education and/ or training by meeting transport costs. The eligibility assumes pupils are not in Independent settings, but local authorities who cannot provide for some with additional needs often use such placements.
attributes.additional_details: The result is that families on a low income with children who have additional needs are financially discriminated against. Often the reason many families with a child who has additional needs are on a low income is due to the care needs of that child.

attributes.action: Abolish the Solicitors Regulation Authority
attributes.background: We already have the Legal Ombudsman to protect the Public Interest. The Police and Fraud action cover any crimes. The fees generated by the SRA should be paid to the Government to set up an independent, fair and balanced body.
attributes.additional_details: A group of solicitors are now forming an action group as there is a real concern smaller firms may be being targeted by insurance giants who may be using the SRA to ensnare the smaller firms in tangles of red tape that handicap their ability to represent the general public against the insurance giants. This risks preventing access to justice for the public who can’t afford to pay a bigger law firm.

attributes.action: A life sentence should mean there can never be the chance of parole.
attributes.background: A life sentence should mean just that. There should be no chance of parole. The sentencing guidelines need to be changed so that life means life. Whole life tariffs for the most heinous crimes should be mandatory. Life should mean Life.

attributes.action: Make FCO Consular Services statutory, defined and guaranteed
attributes.background: FCO Consular Service is subject to abuse and discrimination. British nationals abroad cannot rely upon the published FCO Customer Charter, as it has an enormous caveat; all help is discretionary, not statutory. British nationals currently have no recourse against the FCO for failing to help them.
attributes.additional_details: Cases prove that one British national will receive consular service while another does not for the exact same needs. The Gillian Gibbons Sudan case proved that the FCO will intervene significantly more the less important the country. Brexit especially requires that the FCO publish a charter that they will honour for each and every British citizen abroad irrespective of the country involved. Also that the FCO is more proactive in cases of civil and human rights abuse.

attributes.action: Make Student Nurses and Midwives eligible for 30 hours free childcare
attributes.background: Earlier in the year, the government introduced 30 hours of free childcare for 3-4 year olds in the UK. It has since emerged that this scheme ignores the workforce of Student Nurses and Midwives with children who work 30+ hours in the NHS, who are now without a bursary and have limited support.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017, Student Nurse and Midwifery applications fell by a staggering 23% after the abolition of NHS Bursaries. These students now need to take out loans and take up second jobs in order to make ends meet. This is even harder for students with children and often forces them to drop out after the first year of training.
There are 24,000 nursing posts in the UK which need filling. This is a change that could benefit thousands of Student Nurses and Midwives, and help fill those vacancies.

attributes.action: Stop charging VAT on vet treatments/animal medicinces
attributes.background: So it's just cost me £278 to have a cut stitched, of this £46 was VAT, as this is for medical treatment to animals, why do we have to pay VAT, imagine how much would be charged on a more complicated operation, £20 in every £100

attributes.action: Ban all trade of Ivory in the UK with NO exceptions!
attributes.background: Elephants’ biggest threat is the trade in their ivory tusks. The UK has become the world’s leading exporter in ivory in recent years. The newly proposed ban contains exceptions, including musical Instruments and items of "cultural importance". The ban should be TOTAL, with no exceptions.
attributes.additional_details: For more information search for "The Truth Behind Your Ivory Trinkets" on YouTube. This video shows the brutal process by which ivory is harvested and contains more information about the ivory trade. Please watch.

attributes.action: Have a general election before summer term 2018
attributes.background: At this time of political uncertainty, Britain needs to have a clear leader and a strong party to back them up. At the moment, the country doesn’t have a party with a strong mandate or a certain one. I believe that we need a chance for all political parties to present to us their arguments.
attributes.additional_details: So that we can decided clearly and indecisively who runs The U.K. This last general election failed us. The Conservative party clearly Expected to win and didn’t present their side, and labour fought but didn’t give a clear plan for their brexit, however now that Labour, like the Conservatives, have clarified their brexit strategy we, the British people deserve to make a choice, to benefit is locally and nationally.

attributes.action: Create a bank holiday to celebrate the marriage of Prince Harry & Meghan Markle
attributes.background: Today a spokesperson for the Prime Minister stated there was no intention of holding a bank holiday. People should be allowed to rejoice in the marriage of Prince Harry & Meghan Markle. There is precedent for this. A bank holiday was granted for the marriage of The Duke & Duchess of Cambridge.

attributes.action: Help stop the government plans to decentralise ALL sexual violence funding.
attributes.background: At RASA Merseyside we are trying to #shinealight into the darkness of the hidden horrors of rape and sexual abuse. More individuals are coming forward and asking for support. Recently funding for sexual violence support services has remained constant or dropped.
attributes.additional_details: This plan in 2018/19 would be disastrous for many services, despite the evidence pointing to the problems this will cause for established services that rely on such funding for their core service delivery. It is likely there will be less support available for survivors, as decentralised funds are consumed by other priority local needs. We can already see a decrease in service levels and an increase in waiting times for support. We ask that the government urgently reconsider this proposed action.

attributes.action: Abolish universal credit return to old system!
attributes.background: New universal credit replaces JSA, income support, ESA, Housing benefit, Tax credits and working tax credits. Government says universal credit will make work pay. This is rubbish. Universal credit is about cutting the social security bill meaning millions will be worse off.
attributes.additional_details: Once fully implemented will mean easier sanctioning forcing people to live on nothing. Housing subsidy will be time limited forcing more to be homeless. Support for childcare will be drastically cut. Disability element's cut or abolished altogether. Some rates are much lower than current benefit rates. Government has so far wasted hundreds of millions. They will save billions taking from the needy and most vulnerable in our society. This is a war against the poor. Whilst they prop up the rich!

attributes.action: Guarantee equal or better funding for scientific research in the UK after Brexit
attributes.background: We rely heavily on EU research funding ~€1.2 billion p.a. from Horizon 2020, there is no clear plan on how this will be replaced after Brexit. I ask that the future funding is guaranteed and extra UK grants are made that at least match or better the input from Horizon 2020 to UK HE institutions.
attributes.additional_details:
At time of writing, there is no deal for joint EU-UK research funding after Brexit. The UK will not have access to the same amount of funding and hundreds of top level research jobs will be lost due to the shortfall, unless the UK government increases domestic research budgets. https://ec.europa.eu/unitedkingdom/news/uk-institutions-and-researchers-top-recipients-eu-innovation-funding_en

UK HE institutes received ~€1.2 billion in 2015 http://ec.europa.eu/budget/figures/interactive/index_en.cfm

attributes.action: Prevent President Buhari and all state Governors of Nigeria from entering the UK
attributes.background: Nigerian Government troops have entered SE Nigeria under Python Dance II. It's an act of provocation. The UK Government must act by banning President Buhari and all state governors of Nigeria from entering the UK.

attributes.action: Ask Parliament to debate the Basic Income
attributes.background: Britain is the 6th richest country on earth, yet 1/3rd of British children live in poverty. 3.8 million Brits in work live in poverty. A majority of people live paycheck to paycheck. The botched rollout of universal credits made matters worse. It's time for parliament to debate the basic income.
attributes.additional_details:
In the face of these devastating facts, many people have argued that giving everyone a small, monthly sum of money to cover their basic needs, without any work requirement, would significantly salvage the situation. This is what's called a basic income.

All we ask is for parliament to put all the ideas that may help deal with the issues outlined above on the table. That is literally their job. It's what they get paid to do. Ask parliament to debate the basic income.

attributes.action: Let councils borrow to build council housing. Lift the government cap.
attributes.background:
Private tenancies are insecure, expensive and many fail to meet basic standards. 
So called "affordable housing" at 80% of market rents is not genuinely affordable. A programme  of council house building will help address the housing crisis, and council housing pays for itself in the long run.
attributes.additional_details:
Government rules severely restrict council's ability to borrow to build desperately needed council housing.
Council housing funding also needs to be raised to a sustainable level.

attributes.action: A referendum on the ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
attributes.background:
There are continuous debates on the use of the Foreign Aid Budget, from many different sides. Lets have the people that earn / provide the money decide how it should be used, if we are to have one at all.
I suggest four choices: (5th if we use remaining monies for Elderly Care)
attributes.additional_details:
1.	Change nothing maintain the 0.7% of GDP on overseas aid
2.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government on using the 0.7% of GDP for anything else & all remaining monies to be ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
3.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government using the 0.7% of GDP all remaining monies to be spent on replacing the EU subsidies, based upon % share of monies provided by the EU
4. No Foreign Aid Budget

attributes.action: Start dredging rivers regularly in the help of flood prevention.
attributes.background: Cumbria has suffered many bad floods over the last 13 years and it's time something was done. Flood defences only slow down the water but actually clearing the rivers of silt and debris would be more effective. Also allowing farmers to manage rivers flowing through their land.

attributes.action: The new sex education curriculum should explain what constitutes sexual assault
attributes.background: Social media phenomenon #MeToo revealed the under-reported prevalence of sexual assault. The new Relationships & Sex Education curriculum, due 2019, must explain to all genders exactly what constitutes sexual assault and harassment; both to prevent it happening and encourage victims to come forward.
attributes.additional_details:
Education secretary Justine Greening's much-needed, widely-applauded new curriculum covers consent, but doesn't specifically explain the arguably grey areas of sexual assault and harassment. Many victims of "minor" assaults don't understand that what they've experienced is a crime; or feel it's too common to be worth reporting. To reduce sexual assault and support the victims, we must first teach young people exactly what it is.

http://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN06103
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/blogs-trending-41633857
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/sexual-harassment-poll-yougov-young-people-night-out-a7972991.html

attributes.action: The government should not be transferring all EU Regulations into British law.
attributes.background:
All EU law is bad law.  We do not want one single word of it in British law. The government is transferring 170,000 pages of EU Regulations and Directives into English law. 
It is all just EU Red Tape and it is strangling British industry. 
Say no to the Acquis Communautaire.
